required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Renin and Renal Biomarker Response to Angiotensin II
clinical_study.official_title: Renin and Renal Biomarker Response to Angiotensin II Versus Controls in Septic Shock: An Open-Label Study

brief_summary.textblock: Septic shock continues to exert a large economic burden around the world. Several developments have occurred that lead to the current study. First, angiotensin II is the newest FDA approved vasopressor agent indicated for use in vasodilatory shock. Several subgroups from the approval trial have indicated that angiotensin II may confer a survival benefit in certain conditions, including those patients requiring continuous renal replacement therapy, those with altered angiotensin I: angiotensin II ratios, and most recently, those with elevated renin levels (which may serve as a surrogate for dysfunctional angiotensin 1: angiotensin II ratios). This open-label, sequential period pilot study will evaluate angiotensin II and biomarker response (renin) in the treatment of septic shock.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Until shock resolution, up to 14 days (at baseline, 3 hours, 24 hours, and shock resolution, up to 14 days)
primary_outcome.description: Plasma renin levels will be measured from blood collected at baseline, 24 hours, and at shock resolution. Additionally, a 3-hour measurement will be included in the angiotensin II arm.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until shock resolution, up to 14 days (at baseline, 24 hours, and shock resolution, up to 14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Cystatin C, NGAL will be measured from blood collected at baseline, 24 hours, and at shock resolution.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until shock resolution, up to 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Time from enrollment to discontinuation of catecholamines

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to ICU discharge, up to 28 days following enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days in the intensive care unit (ICU).
Assessment of all-cause mortality within hospital admission
Days free of renal replacement therapy from enrollment up to day 28

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 72 hours following shock resolution, no longer than 17 days from enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of venous thromboembolism, arrhythmia, extremity hypoperfusion, delirium, new ischemic event, new infection

arm_group.description: Patients in this group will receive standard of care treatment.
Patients in this group will receive angiotensin II.

intervention.description: These patients will receive standard of care treatment. Plasma renin levels and biomarkers of renal function will be measured.
These patients will receive angiotensin II in addition to standard of care treatment. Plasma renin levels and biomarkers of renal function will be measured.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical ICU admission
- Septic shock
- Norepinephrine requirement = 0.15 mcg/kg/min for = 30 minutes (if cirrhosis, norepinephrine requirement = 0.1 mcg/kg/min for = 30 minutes)
- Kidney Disease Improving Global Outcomes stage 1 or greater AKI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prisoner
- Pregnancy
- Acute occlusive coronary syndrome requiring intervention or acute myocardial infarction of any degree
- Purely cardiogenic shock (no distributive component)
- Mesenteric ischemia
- Acute ischemic stroke
- Hemorrhagic shock
- Active treatment of hepatorenal syndrome targeting a MAP = 65 mm Hg
- Planned withdrawal of care within next 24 hours or no escalation of care
- Patient enrolled in an interventional study
- High likelihood of medical futility in using this drug:
- 3 or more vasopressors required to sustain MAP
- Sustained norepinephrine equivalents > 0.5 mcg/kg/min
- COVID-19 positive, or high suspicion of COVID-19

facility.name: University of Kentucky HealthCare Chandler Medical Center
